summary:
The Tang Dynasty (618-907) was a golden age in Chinese history, known for its cultural achievements. Founded by the Li family, it followed the Sui Dynasty and ruled a vast territory, including parts of Central Asia. The capital, Chang'an, was the world's largest city.

This period saw great advancements in poetry, art, and literature. Famous poets like Li Bai and Du Fu wrote during this time. Woodblock printing was also developed. Buddhism flourished but later faced suppression. The dynasty's power declined due to rebellions and regional governors' growing power, leading to the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period.
title: Tang dynasty
